page.title: 04THE MANOR HOUSE
page.content: The Manor House, Station Road The Manor House is a large house of great character which was built in 1791. It is a listed building which means that the front of the house may not be altered. We interviewed Mrs Dorothy Bunting who moved into the house in 1964 when Miss Williamson died. The Manor House was built by an ancestor of Miss Williamson's and it is said that there are as many bricks in the cellars as there are in the house above ground. In 1964 there was no electricity or water in the house. The original furniture is still there. The house is now heated by an oil-fired Aga in the kitchen and wood fires in the other rooms. Mrs. Bunting gives the top class of the village school a conducted tour of the Manor House shortly before they leave the school.
